abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Project Completion Report
            (PCR) for the Integrated Rural Development Project - Third
            Integrated Investment Program for Rural Development (PIDER)
            in Mexico. The overall outcome of the project was
            satisfactory; the performance of the Bank and the borrower
            is rated satisfactory. In May 1980, Government issued a
            policy paper on PIDER re-focusing program objectives to: a)
            promote a self-sustained development process within rural
            communities and b) guarantee access to goods and services
            which provide adequate living standards. The third PIDER
            objective was to increase the development impact of the
            existing program by supporting Government's efforts to
            expand and intensify activities in seventeen selected
            micro-regions (MRs) located in the states of Guerrero,
            Sinaloa, Yucatan, and Zacatecas. The project became
            effective May 1982, the year of two devaluations and
            economic deterioration of crisis proportion. Start-up
            activities were delayed due to insufficient counterpart
            funds and a change in political administration which
            instituted reorganization, a freeze on hiring and
            considerable staff movements at various levels of
            Government. The third PIDER provides lessons for improvement
            for both the Borrower and the Bank. They are to: (a) devise
            measures which allow programs to transcend institutional
            discontinuities, (b) require in-depth evaluations as a
            pre-condition to making fundamental changes in project
            design, (c) return to programming investments, at every
            administrative level, with a more long-term perspective so
            that prospective actions in related program areas can be
            more appropriately integrated; and (d) apply more thoroughly
            economic, financial, and technical appraisal criteria for
            sub-project investments and ensure adherence.
